<a href="https://www.startengine.com/blendid?utm_source=seblendidlandingpage&utm_medium=partnership01_08-13" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Blendid" style="width:100%;max-width: 109px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="109" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby83MzEvMTYyNjg4MzU0OS1ibGVuZGlkX2xvZ28ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>and Happy Friday the 13th (luckily, the only one this year). If you’re feeling superstitious today, you aren't alone. We asked around the virtual office to find out our colleagues’ most bizarre rituals.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tiffany, designer: </strong></span><span>“I listen to ‘Solsbury Hill’ by Peter Gabriel before every job interview.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jordan, director of accounting: </strong></span><span>“I wore the same Phish T-shirt (2013 summer tour) to all my CPA exams.”</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Henry, copywriter:</strong></span><span> “At sundown before a new fiscal quarter, I take a shower and condition my hair with Hellmann's mayonnaise.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stay vigilant today. </p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DEMOGRAPHICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/12/census-data-shows-white-population-dropped-us-first-time?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We Know Where You Live This Summer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/12/census-data-shows-white-population-dropped-us-first-time?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Illustration of the United States map" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjEwL2NlbnN1c19tYXAucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every 10 years, the census helps Americans answer the deepest of questions: Who are we? And why is everyone moving to western North Dakota? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The government dropped the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/12/us/census-results-data?utm_source=morning_brew#a-rise-in-hispanic-and-asian-population-fuels-us-growth-census-reports" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first detailed results</a> from the 2020 count yesterday, revealing a country that’s more racially diverse, urban, and Phoenician than it was in the previous tally a decade ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong></p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Data on where people live will be used in a bruising battle by politicians to redraw boundaries for voting districts. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>These numbers will be leveraged by many businesses to inform market research, expansion efforts, and local labor conditions. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It determines where governments allocate spending.</span></li>
</ol>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Hit me with the details</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The headline stat: </strong>The US became a lot more racially diverse over the past 10 years. The non-Hispanic white population dropped for the first time on record (2.6%), falling to its <a href="https://apnews.com/article/census-2020-house-elections-4ee80e72846c151aa41a808b06d975ea?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest share</a> of the total population on record. People who identify as Hispanic, Asian, and more than one race drove all the population growth during the last decade.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Still, that growth has slowed down: </strong>The US population increased 7.4% from 2010 to 2020, the lowest growth rate since the 1930s. It’s not good news. Less people growth = less economic growth, and a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/covid19-baby-bust-us-see-500k-fewer-births-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">baby bust</a> from the pandemic threatens to pinch the US’ growth rate even more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cities are getting bigger while rural areas empty out: </strong>“Population growth was almost entirely in metropolitan areas,” the US Census Bureau’s Marc Perry said. 52% of all counties shrank in population. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Chris Paul knows: </strong>Phoenix overtook Philadelphia as the fifth-largest city in the US, following NYC, LA, Chicago, and Houston. The leaderboard change reflects the broader trend of people relocating to the South and West from the Northeast and Midwest. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Meet the fastest growing metro area: </strong>The Villages, a retirement community in central Florida. Its population grew 39% over the last decade, but also shrunk three inches in height.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And the fastest growing county? </strong>McKenzie County, North Dakota, which grew more than 100% since 2010 thanks to a <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2021/08/06/north-dakota-republicans-oil-fracking-environment-502308?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fracking boom</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the redistricting fight, which could determine who controls the House in 2022, begins now. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/12/reddits-valuation-upvoted-10-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wall Street Bets On Reddit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reddit, the ancestral birthplace of memes, is now worth $10 billion following its latest funding injection from Fidelity. The social media company’s valuation has <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/0029521a-0cb1-400b-9723-a248b4d3ff2d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than tripled</a> over the past 2.5 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CEO Steve Huffman credited the wave of attention Reddit received for its role in the meme stock frenzy this winter for attracting new users, advertisers, and capital. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Despite its outsized cultural influence, Reddit’s still just a guppy swimming <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/12/22621445/reddit-valuation-revenue-funding-round?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">among sharks</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It has 52 million daily active users, compared to Twitter’s 206 million and Snapchat’s 293 million.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reddit recorded $100 million in ad revenue last quarter, which is a 192% annual increase but comes nowhere near Twitter’s $1.2 billion and Facebook’s $28.6 billion.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, that guppy’s booked a ride on the East Australian Current. Huffman said Reddit’s keen on upgrading its site—by, for instance, improving video sharing—and adding more staffers to a workforce that’s doubled over the last one and a half years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Reddit’s “still planning on going public,” Huffman told the NYT...but has “no firm timeline yet.” We’ll be lurking on <a href="https://www.reddit.com/r/SecurityAnalysis/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">r/SecurityAnalysis</a> until then.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/12/field-dreams-game-brought-thousands-visitors-small-iowa-town?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
‘Iowa Is the Place to Be Tonight’—First Heard August 12, 2021
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/12/field-dreams-game-brought-thousands-visitors-small-iowa-town?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="DYERSVILLE, IL - AUGUST 12:  The scoreboard is seen before the game betw..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjEzL25ld195b3JrX3lhbmtlZXNfdl9jaGljYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Daniel Shirey/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last night in Dyersville, Iowa, the Chicago White Sox hit a <a href="https://www.nj.com/yankees/2021/08/yankees-rally-late-then-blow-slugfest-to-white-sox-in-field-of-dreams-game-rapid-reaction.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">walk-off HR</a> against the NY Yankees in the first MLB regular-season game ever to take place in Iowa, and only a short stroll-through-a-cornfield away from the field featured in <em>Field of Dreams</em>. You couldn't script it any better.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> The 1989 flick put the 4,000-person, three-hotel Iowa town on the map, but it wasn’t until 2016 when MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred <a href="https://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/sports/baseball/2021/08/04/field-of-dreams-game-mlb-tickets-rob-manfred-chicago-white-sox-new-york-yankees/5476358001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">visited</a> the original field and thought, “Let’s get Aaron Judge out here.” The MLB initially scheduled the game for 2020, but it was pushed back because of the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The mayor of Dyersville, perfectly named James Heavens, said the town expected 10,000 fans, support staff, and members of the media to arrive for the game. But nostalgia ain’t cheap. The average ticket price for the game on TickPick was <a href="https://twitter.com/TickPick/status/1425863659247575049?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$1,343</a>, compared to $803 for a World Series game.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead</strong>...Mayor Heavens hopes Dyersville will become a regular stop on MLB’s schedule, and he may just get his wish. "I think the reception that this has received has been so positive that we will be back," Manfred said. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Disney+ has <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/12/disney-dis-fiscal-q3-2021-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">116 million subscribers</a>, the company said in its earnings report yesterday. To illustrate how impressive that is, Disney initially projected that the streaming service would hit between 60 million to 90 million subscribers...by 2024. Together with ESPN+ and Hulu, Disney has nearly 174 million subscriptions, breathing down the neck of Netflix, which has <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/business/digital/netflix-q2-2021-earnings-1234985080/?utm_source=morning_brew#:~:text=Netflix's%20total%20subscriber%20base%20now,more%20than%201%20million%20subscribers." target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">209 million</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>“It is very serious. It is like you’re a farmer and it doesn’t rain.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2021 has <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/52c74f23-8bfc-44ac-bae8-663b369bd186?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not been a breeze</a> for Mads Nipper, the CEO of offshore wind company Orsted. <p class="body-text" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Adam and Eve play rock-paper-scissors 10 times. You know that:</p>
<ul class="body-ul" style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Adam uses rock three times, scissors six times, and paper once.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Eve uses rock twice, scissors four times, and paper four times.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>There are no ties in all 10 games.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The order of games is unknown.</span></li>
</ul>
<p class="body-text" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who wins? By how much?</p>
</td>
</tr>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEvery 10 years, the census helps Americans answer the deepest of questions: Who are we? And why is everyone moving to western North Dakota? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe government dropped the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/12/us/census-results-data?utm_source=morning_brew#a-rise-in-hispanic-and-asian-population-fuels-us-growth-census-reports\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst detailed results\u003c/a\u003e from the 2020 count yesterday, revealing a country that’s more racially diverse, urban, and Phoenician than it was in the previous tally a decade ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eData on where people live will be used in a bruising battle by politicians to redraw boundaries for voting districts. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThese numbers will be leveraged by many businesses to inform market research, expansion efforts, and local labor conditions. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt determines where governments allocate spending.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHit me with the details\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe headline stat: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US became a lot more racially diverse over the past 10 years. The non-Hispanic white population dropped for the first time on record (2.6%), falling to its \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/census-2020-house-elections-4ee80e72846c151aa41a808b06d975ea?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elowest share\u003c/a\u003e of the total population on record. People who identify as Hispanic, Asian, and more than one race drove all the population growth during the last decade.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStill, that growth has slowed down: \u003c/strong\u003eThe US population increased 7.4% from 2010 to 2020, the lowest growth rate since the 1930s. It’s not good news. Less people growth = less economic growth, and a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/18/covid19-baby-bust-us-see-500k-fewer-births-next-year?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebaby bust\u003c/a\u003e from the pandemic threatens to pinch the US’ growth rate even more.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCities are getting bigger while rural areas empty out: \u003c/strong\u003e“Population growth was almost entirely in metropolitan areas,” the US Census Bureau’s Marc Perry said. 52% of all counties shrank in population. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eChris Paul knows: \u003c/strong\u003ePhoenix overtook Philadelphia as the fifth-largest city in the US, following NYC, LA, Chicago, and Houston. The leaderboard change reflects the broader trend of people relocating to the South and West from the Northeast and Midwest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMeet the fastest growing metro area: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Villages, a retirement community in central Florida. Its population grew 39% over the last decade, but also shrunk three inches in height.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd the fastest growing county? \u003c/strong\u003eMcKenzie County, North Dakota, which grew more than 100% since 2010 thanks to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2021/08/06/north-dakota-republicans-oil-fracking-environment-502308?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efracking boom\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe redistricting fight, which could determine who controls the House in 2022, begins now. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReddit, the ancestral birthplace of memes, is now worth $10 billion following its latest funding injection from Fidelity. The social media company’s valuation has \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/0029521a-0cb1-400b-9723-a248b4d3ff2d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than tripled\u003c/a\u003e over the past 2.5 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCEO Steve Huffman credited the wave of attention Reddit received for its role in the meme stock frenzy this winter for attracting new users, advertisers, and capital. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eDespite its outsized cultural influence, Reddit’s still just a guppy swimming \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/12/22621445/reddit-valuation-revenue-funding-round?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eamong sharks\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt has 52 million daily active users, compared to Twitter’s 206 million and Snapchat’s 293 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReddit recorded $100 million in ad revenue last quarter, which is a 192% annual increase but comes nowhere near Twitter’s $1.2 billion and Facebook’s $28.6 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, that guppy’s booked a ride on the East Australian Current. Huffman said Reddit’s keen on upgrading its site—by, for instance, improving video sharing—and adding more staffers to a workforce that’s doubled over the last one and a half years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eReddit’s “still planning on going public,” Huffman told the NYT...but has “no firm timeline yet.” We’ll be lurking on \u003ca href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/SecurityAnalysis/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003er/SecurityAnalysis\u003c/a\u003e until then.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewalk-off HR\u003c/a\u003e against the NY Yankees in the first MLB regular-season game ever to take place in Iowa, and only a short stroll-through-a-cornfield away from the field featured in \u003cem\u003eField of Dreams\u003c/em\u003e. You couldn't script it any better.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e The 1989 flick put the 4,000-person, three-hotel Iowa town on the map, but it wasn’t until 2016 when MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred \u003ca href=\"https://www.desmoinesregister.com/story/sports/baseball/2021/08/04/field-of-dreams-game-mlb-tickets-rob-manfred-chicago-white-sox-new-york-yankees/5476358001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evisited\u003c/a\u003e the original field and thought, “Let’s get Aaron Judge out here.” The MLB initially scheduled the game for 2020, but it was pushed back because of the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe mayor of Dyersville, perfectly named James Heavens, said the town expected 10,000 fans, support staff, and members of the media to arrive for the game. But nostalgia ain’t cheap. The average ticket price for the game on TickPick was \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TickPick/status/1425863659247575049?s=20\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$1,343\u003c/a\u003e, compared to $803 for a World Series game.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/strong\u003e...Mayor Heavens hopes Dyersville will become a regular stop on MLB’s schedule, and he may just get his wish. \"I think the reception that this has received has been so positive that we will be back,\" Manfred said. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
